Key Arguments: The legislation is viewed as government overreach, similar to measures taken during the pandemic.
Concerns about the erosion of fundamental freedoms of speech and communication.
Distrust in unelected bureaucrats making decisions on what constitutes misinformation.
Belief that the legislation is a means to silence dissent against the government narrative.
Concerns about the accountability of ACMA and the adequacy of provisions to protect freedom of expression.
Criticism of imposing fines on social media outlets as a form of bullying.
Notable Quotes: This Bill seems like an extension of the incredible overreach that played out during the pandemic.
Do you, the Australian government, plan to ditch our fundamental freedoms of speech and communication as outlined in the UN Declaration of Human Rights?
This Bill is simply a way to silence anyone who goes against the government narrative. Sounds like Communism to me.
I see us like dumb sheep being slowly herded into a paddock by our bureaucratic overlords.
